intro: Zexmenia arnottii f. dubia, commonly known as the Dubia Zexmenia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a leathery texture. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
